title: TikTok Is Sued by Indiana, Alleging It Misleads Users
description: Indiana filed two lawsuits against TikTok, alleging it deceives consumers about content and data security, and should be prohibited from allowing children to access content about sex, profanity and drugs.

title: Tensions Grew at Salesforce Before Leadership Change
description: Marc Benioff became frustrated about how his co-CEO Bret Taylor, who is set to exit the role, was spending his time, people familiar with the executives said.

title: Apple Plans New Encryption System to Ward Off Hackers and Protect iCloud Data
description: “Advanced Data Protection” would offer end-to-end encryption on iCloud backups, Notes, Photos and other Apple services—a step that may draw ire from law enforcement.

title: Apple Plans New Encryption System to Ward Off Hackers and Protect iCloud Data
description: “Advanced Data Protection” would offer end-to-end encryption on iCloud backups, Notes, Photos and other services—a step that may draw ire from law enforcement.

title: What People Googled in 2022: Wordle, Ukraine, Queen Elizabeth
description: The search results offer a glimpse into what people were focused on throughout the year.

title: How AI That Powers Chatbots and Search Queries Could Discover New Drugs
description: Natural language processing algorithms like the ones used in Google searches and OpenAI’s ChatGPT promise to slash the time required to bring medications to market

title: Washington Post Considers Selling Tech Business It Built Up on Bezos's Watch
description: The company is exploring a spinoff or sale of Arc XP, an in-house publishing tool that it has turned into a broader software business.

title: TikTok Faces U.S. Clampdowns After South Dakota Restrictions
description: The app was banned from the state’s agencies over national-security concerns stemming from its Chinese ownership. Other states are following suit.

title: U.S., Europe Need a Grand Bargain on Semiconductors and EVs to Counter China
description: Allies complained U.S. electric-vehicle subsidies mistreat them, yet rebuffed requests from the U.S. to join its restrictions on chip exports to China.

title: Theranos Ex-President Sunny Balwani to Be Sentenced
description: When Theranos’s former No. 2 executive, Ramesh Balwani, is sentenced Wednesday, he may get a longer prison term than his boss, who was at the center of the fraud at the company she founded.

title: A Book on Elon Musk's Twitter Takeover Is Already in the Works
description: “Breaking Twitter” by Ben Mezrich, who wrote the book behind “The Social Network,” is the latest example of quick books on current events.

title: It's Not Just You: Businesses Are Making Their Phone Numbers Hard to Find
description: More customer-facing phone numbers are being replaced with chat boxes and virtual reservation systems that can make connecting to an actual human being next to impossible.

title: Accounting Red Flags Are Common Among Public Crypto Companies
description: Weak controls and related-party transactions appear in disclosures across the industry.

title: Microsoft Pledges to Put 'Call of Duty' on Nintendo Switch If Activision Deal Is Approved
description: Microsoft pledged to give Nintendo access to the popular “Call of Duty” games for a decade if its $75 billion deal to buy the game’s developer, Activision Blizzard, gets approved.

title: Elon Musk's Release of Documents Triggers Twitter Lawyer Jim Baker's Exit
description: Elon Musk said a top Twitter lawyer “was exited,” part of the fallout from the billionaire’s unusual release of internal communications to criticize prior practices at the company.

title: Jeff Bezos's Space Company Bids Again For NASA Moon Lander, After SpaceX Win
description: A group that includes Blue Origin, Boeing and Lockheed Martin wants to build a craft to transport astronauts to the moon.
